subject: Technology
title: Roomba: The Robot in Your Home
description: A fast breakdown of Roomba: The Robot in Your Home for builders.

hook.text: The future of home robots arrived and it vacuums your floor. Not exactly what science fiction promised.

buildup.text: iRobot launched Roomba in 2002. It bumped around rooms randomly, sucking up dirt and cat hair.

discovery.text: Over 40 million Roombas have been sold. It became the first truly successful consumer robot in history.

twist.text: Modern Roombas map your home, avoid obstacles, and empty themselves. They evolved from bumbling to intelligent.

climax.text: Roomba proved that home robots succeed when they solve boring problems, not when they try to impress.

punchline.text: The most popular robot in the world cleans floors. And people love it.

quiz.question: Why was the Roomba the first successful consumer robot?
options: It solved a boring, practical problem people actually had
It could hold conversations with users
